alert.note: Alert for Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 6:13PM EDT until May 14 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of South Central Ohio and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in South Central Ohio, Adams and Highland. In Southwest Ohio, Brown. * WHEN...Until 915 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 613 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... West Union, Winchester, Seaman, Emerald, Cherry Fork, Dunkinsville, Bentonville, State Route 348 at State Route 125, State Route 32 at US Route 62, Fincastle and Cedar Mills.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Keep children away from storm drains, culverts, creeks and streams. Water levels can rise rapidly and sweep children away. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
